doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 10 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 3/2/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 10 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 3/2/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Eleanor Cooper, and Christopher [Wolfe]2. Short news stories3. Discussion of condom distribution and the public airing of condom ads on network television, getting the gay community "condom comfortable"COMMERCIAL: Jose Sarria for SF AIDS Foundation4. Mandatory testing for HIV for those working in the public sectorCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine5. Andy Humm demonstrates proper condom use6. News Watch, Chicago Resource Center awards National Coalition of Black Lesbians and Gays $10,000 to support their magazine, "Black Out"7. California Fair Employment and Housing Commission unanimously rules persons with AIDS protected against discrimination on the job8. New Hepatitis B vaccine not derived from human blood products now in mass production and widely available9. BBC cancels plans to air a two part educational drama on homosexuality due to heated public debate on sex education in schools10. Sports Report11. Lavender Health, interview with Richard Burns, executive director of the Lesbian and Gay Communi
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcement of Robert Latourneau's death, clips from "Boys in the Band"3. The late Arthur Bell's interview of Robert Latourneau from the "Emerald City Tapes"COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball4. Show Bits, George Trahanis reviews the off-Broadway production, "The Musical Comedy Murders of 1940"COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS FoundationCOMMERCIAL: Judge Steven Lachs for the NGTF Fund for Human Dignity5. Closing credits
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 10 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 3/2/1987]: March 1987
